intro: Mauneia madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar star vine, is a climbing plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters. Its fruit is a small, fleshy capsule that contains several seeds. Mauneia madagascariensis is often found in humid, shaded areas of tropical forests.
